issue.title: feat(schema): support custom title, description and default for enums

repository.name: pydantic
repository.description: Data validation using Python type hints

issue.body:
<!-- Thank you for your contribution! -->
<!-- Unless your change is trivial, please create an issue to discuss the change before creating a PR -->
<!-- See https://pydantic-docs.helpmanual.io/contributing/ for help on Contributing -->

## Change Summary
We now have reusable enums thanks to #1432 but default title and description were not customizable. Now they are!
The behaviour has been homogenized by setting the `title` by default (as it is for all the other types).

ℹ️ Doc doesn't need any update as the schema is generated from `docs/examples/schema_main.py`

## Related issue number
closes #1748
closes #1856

## Checklist

* [x] Unit tests for the changes exist
* [x] Tests pass on CI and coverage remains at 100%
* [x] Documentation reflects the changes where applicable
* [x] `changes/<pull request or issue id>-<github username>.md` file added describing change
  (see [changes/README.md](https://github.com/samuelcolvin/pydantic/blob/master/changes/README.md) for details)

body:
Hello @joshourisman,

You're totally right! I opened a PR #1749 to support this. Feel free to try it out and comment if you see anything unexpected.

issue.title: Can't seem to specify a title for an Enum field

repository.name: fastapi
repository.description: FastAPI framework, high performance, easy to learn, fast to code, ready for production

issue.body:
When I try and specify a field title for an Enum type, the title doesn't appear in the docs. I'm new to FastAPI so I'm probably making a simple mistake. Here's an example:

```Python
from enum import Enum

from fastapi import FastAPI

from pydantic import BaseModel, Field

import uvicorn

app = FastAPI()


class ResolutionEnum(str, Enum):
    daily = 'daily'
    hourly = 'hourly'


class Item(BaseModel):
    resolution: ResolutionEnum = Field(title="Resolution of Item")


@app.post("/items/")
async def create_item(item: Item):
    return item


if __name__ == '__main__':
    uvicorn.run(app)
```

I'd expect the docs to give the title "Resolution of Item" but it just gives the default "ResolutionEnum". Thanks for your help!

issue.title: Fixes a regression where Enum fields would not propagate keyword arguments to the schema

repository.name: pydantic
repository.description: Data validation using Python type hints

issue.body:
<!-- Thank you for your contribution! -->
<!-- Unless your change is trivial, please create an issue to discuss the change before creating a PR -->
<!-- See https://pydantic-docs.helpmanual.io/contributing/ for help on Contributing -->
## Change Summary
Ensures `Enum` fields defined with additional keyword arguments have their schema updated in the same way as other fields.

ℹ️ Regression introduced by #1749 in v1.7.0

## Related issue number
#2108

<!-- Are there any issues opened that will be resolved by merging this change? -->

## Checklist

* [x] Unit tests for the changes exist
* [x] Tests pass on CI and coverage remains at 100%
* [x] Documentation reflects the changes where applicable
* [x] `changes/<pull request or issue id>-<github username>.md` file added describing change
  (see [changes/README.md](https://github.com/samuelcolvin/pydantic/blob/master/changes/README.md) for details)

repository.name: jina-hub
repository.description: An open-registry for hosting Jina executors via container images

issue.title: Can't set custom title for enum field

repository.name: pydantic
repository.description: Data validation using Python type hints

issue.body:
### Checks

* [y] I added a descriptive title to this issue
* [y] I have searched (google, github) for similar issues and couldn't find anything
* [y] I have read and followed [the docs](https://pydantic-docs.helpmanual.io/) and still think this is a bug

# Bug

Output of `python -c "import pydantic.utils; print(pydantic.utils.version_info())"`:
```
             pydantic version: 1.7.4
            pydantic compiled: True
                 install path: /usr/local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/pydantic
               python version: 3.8.11 (default, Aug 17 2021, 03:04:29)  [GCC 8.3.0]
                     platform: Linux-5.13.0-1019-aws-x86_64-with-glibc2.2.5
     optional deps. installed: ['typing-extensions']
```
I have an enum field, color_choice. I would like the schema to include the title 'Color Choice' (with a space).

First attempt:

```py
import json
from enum import Enum

from pydantic import BaseModel


class ColorChoice(str, Enum):
    RED = "RED"
    BLUE = "BLUE"


class Shape(BaseModel):
    color_choice: ColorChoice


print(json.dumps(json.loads(Shape.schema_json()), indent=4))

# Result:
# {
#     "title": "Shape",
#     "type": "object",
#     "properties": {
#         "color_choice": {
#             "$ref": "#/definitions/ColorChoice"
#         }
#     },
#     "required": [
#         "color_choice"
#     ],
#     "definitions": {
#         "ColorChoice": {
#             "title": "ColorChoice",
#             "description": "An enumeration.",
#             "enum": [
#                 "RED",
#                 "BLUE"
#             ],
#             "type": "string"
#         }
#     }
# }
```
If I try setting the title using Field, I get an extra `allOf`, and the title without the space is still included in the ref.
```py
import json
from enum import Enum

from pydantic import BaseModel, Field


class ColorChoice(str, Enum):
    RED = "RED"
    BLUE = "BLUE"


class Shape(BaseModel):
    color_choice: ColorChoice = Field(
        title="Color Choice",
    )


print(json.dumps(json.loads(Shape.schema_json()), indent=4))

# Result:
# {
#     "title": "Shape",
#     "type": "object",
#     "properties": {
#         "color_choice": {
#             "title": "Color Choice",
#             "allOf": [
#                 {
#                     "$ref": "#/definitions/ColorChoice"
#                 }
#             ]
#         }
#     },
#     "required": [
#         "color_choice"
#     ],
#     "definitions": {
#         "ColorChoice": {
#             "title": "ColorChoice",
#             "description": "An enumeration.",
#             "enum": [
#                 "RED",
#                 "BLUE"
#             ],
#             "type": "string"
#         }
#     }
# }
```
I am hoping to just get:
```py
# {
#     "title": "Shape",
#     "type": "object",
#     "properties": {
#         "color_choice": {
#             "$ref": "#/definitions/ColorChoice"
#         }
#     },
#     "required": [
#         "color_choice"
#     ],
#     "definitions": {
#         "ColorChoice": {
#             "title": "Color Choice",
#             "enum": [
#                 "RED",
#                 "BLUE"
#             ],
#             "type": "string"
#         }
#     }
# }
```
I have found these somewhat similar issues:
https://github.com/samuelcolvin/pydantic/issues/1748
https://github.com/samuelcolvin/pydantic/pull/1749
https://github.com/samuelcolvin/pydantic/issues/2592
https://github.com/samuelcolvin/pydantic/issues/3896

Thanks in advance!
